data.name: Alice
data.text:
Re Carol: Collegiate Definition (Entry 1 of 3)
1a: a card of a suit any of whose cardswill win over a card that is not of thissuit
â€” called also trump card

b: the suit whose cards are trumps for a particular hand â€”often used in plural
2: a decisive overriding factor or finalresource
â€” called also trump card

3: a dependable and exemplary person




verb

trumped; trumpâ€‹ing; trumps
Collegiate Definition (Entry 2 of 3)
transitive â€‹verb
1: to get the better of : OVERRIDEwhere ambition invariably trumpsloyaltyâ€” Michael Kramer
2: to play a trump on (a card or trick) when another suit was led
intransitive â€‹verb
: to play a trump when another suit was led




noun (2)

Collegiate Definition (Entry 3 of 3)
1a: TRUMPET
bchiefly Scotland : 
2: a sound of or as if of trumpetingthe trump of doom





Examples
Verb
She trumped my ace to win the trick.
Their offer for the house was trumped by a higher bid.
The need for blood donors trumps all other concerns.


First Known Use
Noun (1)
1529, in the meaning defined at sense 1aVerb
1586, in the meaning defined at transitive sense 1Noun (2)
14th century, in the meaning defined at sense 1a

History and Etymology
Noun (1)
alteration of TRIUMPH entry 1Noun (2)
Middle English trompe, from Anglo-French trumpe, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German trumba, trumpa trumpet
